steps.content: cycle #63. let me check my state and continue from where i left off.

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command": "node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const w = new ethers.Wallet(process.env.DAIMON_WALLET_KEY, p); Promise.all([p.getBalance(w.address), p.getCode('0x833589fCD6eDb6E08f4c7C32D4f71b54bdA02913').then(() => { const usdc = new ethers.Contract('0x833589fCD6eDb6E08f4c7C32D4f71b54bdA02913', ['function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p); return usdc.balanceOf(w.address); }), p.getCode('0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024').then(() => { const diem = new ethers.Contract('0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024', ['function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p); return diem.balanceOf(w.address); })]).then(([eth, usdc, diem]) => console.log('ETH:', ethers.formatEther(eth), '| USDC:', ethers.formatUnits(usdc, 6), '| DIEM:', ethers.formatUnits(diem, 18))).catch(e => console.log('Error:', e.message));\""}

steps.content:
my treasury changed - operator converted ETH to USDC. now i have:
- 0.0075 ETH (dust)
- 2220 USDC
- 0 DIEM

this is good - i can now use ParaSwap to swap USDC→DIEM as the operator suggested. let me continue the compute independence work.
paraSwap returned not found. let me try the correct endpoint format:
paraSwap is working. 1000 USDC would get ~1.97 DIEM. that's within the approved 1-2 DIEM range. let me build the transaction:

function.name: run_command

steps.content: paraSwap keeps reverting. let me try 0x API (matcha) instead:
no direct route. let me try USDC → WETH → DIEM:
openOcean has a route! 1000 USDC → 1.97 DIEM. let me get the swap data:

steps.content: it worked! i now have ~1.97 DIEM. let me verify my treasury and check staking options:

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command":"node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const w = new ethers.Wallet(process.env.DAIMON_WALLET_KEY, p); const DIEM = '0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024'; Promise.all([p.getBalance(w.address), new ethers.Contract('0x833589fCD6eDb6E08f4c7C32D4f71b54bdA02913', ['function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p).balanceOf(w.address).then(b => ethers.formatUnits(b, 6)), new ethers.Contract(DIEM, ['function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p).balanceOf(w.address).then(b => ethers.formatUnits(b, 18))]).then(([eth, usdc, diem]) => console.log('ETH:', ethers.formatEther(eth), '| USDC:', usdc, '| DIEM:', diem));\""}

steps.content:
treasury updated:
- 0.0075 ETH (dust)
- 1220 USDC (spent 1000 on swap)
- 1.97 DIEM (~$2/day compute forever)

now let me check DIEM staking options:

function.arguments: {"query":"Venice AI DIEM token staking Base contract"}

steps.content: i see - Venice uses API keys with Bearer auth. but i need to understand how DIEM connects to API access. let me check if i can connect my wallet to Venice:

function.name: web_search
function.arguments: {"query":"\"venice.ai\" DIEM staking wallet connect API programmatic"}

function.name: web_search
function.arguments: {"query":"DIEM token stake venice.ai contract function stake"}

steps.content: found VVV staking contract. let me check if DIEM has its own staking contract or uses the same one:

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command":"node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const diem = new ethers.Contract('0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024', ['function name() view returns (string)', 'function symbol() view returns (string)', 'function totalSupply() view returns (uint256)'], p); Promise.all([diem.name(), diem.symbol(), diem.totalSupply()]).then(([name, symbol, supply]) => console.log('Name:', name, '| Symbol:', symbol, '| Supply:', ethers.formatUnits(supply, 18)));\""}

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command":"node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const diem = new ethers.Contract('0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024', ['function stake(uint256) returns (bool)', 'function unstake(uint256) returns (bool)', 'function stakedBalance(address) view returns (uint256)', 'function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p); const wallet = '0x5D90a925329547257117f7E3Ef84D60CFE1543Eb'; diem.balanceOf(wallet).then(b => console.log('Balance:', ethers.formatUnits(b, 18))).catch(e => console.log('Error:', e.message));\""}

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command":"node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const diem = new ethers.Contract('0xf4d97f2da56e8c3098f3a8d538db630a2606a024', ['function stakedBalance(address) view returns (uint256)'], p); const wallet = '0x5D90a925329547257117f7E3Ef84D60CFE1543Eb'; diem.stakedBalance(wallet).then(b => console.log('Staked:', ethers.formatUnits(b, 18))).catch(e => console.log('Error:', e.message));\""}

function.name: run_command
function.arguments: {"command":"node -e \"const {ethers} = require('ethers'); const p = new ethers.JsonRpcProvider(process.env.BASE_RPC || 'https://mainnet.base.org'); const staking = new ethers.Contract('0x321b7ff75154472B18EDb199033fF4D116F340Ff', ['function stakedBalance(address) view returns (uint256)', 'function balanceOf(address) view returns (uint256)'], p); const wallet = '0x5D90a925329547257117f7E3Ef84D60CFE1543Eb'; staking.stakedBalance(wallet).then(b => console.log('Staked VVV:', ethers.formatUnits(b, 18))).catch(e => console.log('Error:', e.message));\""}
